text:
Improvement pill here I want to start
this year off by discussing a concept

that can lead to massive amounts of
success this year if you internalize it

and it's a very very simple concept
imagine a circle that represents the

amount of free time we have every day
for purposes of this video we're just

gonna assume that we're sleeping eight
hours a day and that we have to either

go to work or go to school for another
eight hours that leaves about eight

hours every single day where we're free
to do whatever we want how do most

people spend this time well I'd say most
people spend a third of their free time

on entertainment they're watching
Netflix playing video games scrolling

through social media another third is
spent focused on socializing they're

talking to people hanging out with their
friends or going out for drinks and the

last third is usually spent on chores
they're commuting to places they're

buying groceries or they're doing their
laundry the concept that I want you to

understand is that we become what we
expose ourselves to and this is because

of something called cognitive dissonance
which is the uncomfortable feeling we

get when we hold two separate beliefs at
the same time let's say for example

we're learning that we should stay away
from sugar every single day we're

listening to podcasts watching YouTube
videos of people we trust speaking about

this subject and it's getting drilled
into our mind it's going to be very

uncomfortable for us to continue to eat
sugar we're naturally going to want to

stay away from it because we've started
to form a belief that sugar is bad the

problem is most people don't use their
free time to expose themselves to

anything productive watching TV or
drinking with your friends is fine and

all but you're not exposing yourself to
anything that can make you into a better

person without exposing yourself to new
beliefs there will never be cognitive

dissonance which means there will be no
change if you want to see progress this

year all you have to do is spend more of
your free time exposing yourself to

things that you want to improve on and
it doesn't have to be a lot of time a

lot of people lose their motivation to
reach their new year's resolution really

really fast because they think oh I have
to work hard non-stop I have to

completely give up everything I enjoy
and oftentimes people if this sort of

mindset simply get burnt out we humans
need time to relax and enjoy ourselves

as long as you're exposing yourself
every single day to concepts that could

potentially improve your life you'll see
a tremendous amount of progress here's

an example of an effective way we could
reallocate our free time using the

example from before we don't have to
change anything about the time we spend

on entertainment or the amount of time
we spend on socializing but what we can

do is change something about the way we
do our chores instead of going on

autopilot and thinking about random
things while we're doing our chores we

could listen to a podcast or a video on
an area of our life that we'd like to

improve on imagine listening to podcasts
on social skills every single day the

next time you're socializing with some
people you might remember some of the

tips you learned while you're doing your
laundry and because of cognitive

dissonance you would actually feel
uncomfortable if you didn't use some of

the tips you've been exposing yourself
to and over time you naturally

accumulate practice and actually see
some progress in your social skills it's

that simple but very few people actually
do this they have huge goals each year

but they don't spend any time exposing
themselves to concepts that would

motivate them to chase after these goals
so just remember this if you want this

year to be your best year yet
constantly expose yourself to the things

you want to improve on if you're trying
to lose weight expose yourselves to

content about nutrition and fitness if
you want to improve your finances expose

yourself to content about investing and
saving if you want to improve your

social life expose yourself to content
about public speaking and if you want to

improve your overall happiness expose
yourself to content about meditation and

mindfulness by doing this you will start
to adopt new beliefs which in turn will

trigger cognitive dissonance and
eventually cause you to take action and

see actual change in these areas
speaking of content that you can expose

yourself to this episode was brought to
you to help the guys at blink is blanket

steaks over 2,000 of the most popular
non-fiction books and grabs all of the

key points for you to consume so instead
of having to read 500 pages you can just

spend 15 minutes reading their insights
and leave with the same amount of

knowledge gained and what I love about
blankets is that they offer audio

versions of all of their insights this
means you can learn about the key

concepts of powerful books while you're
folding your laundry or comb

to work which is an extremely effective
way you can expose yourself to beliefs

that you'd like to adopt Linkous has
content on everything you need to

succeed this year from saving money to
be more productive and living a

healthier life so if you're ready to
make 2018 your year then click on the

link in the description box below to
start your free trial or enjoy 20% off

their yearly plan which i think is super
affordable and is an amazing investment

the insight that I'm currently listening
to is the like switch by Jack Sheaffer

which I definitely recommend you guys to
check out
